articles.author: chengouzi
articles.description:
chengouzi: 
我现在觉得背着 macbook 来回上下班有点沉也有点麻烦
背笔记本的原因是 开发环境以及项目修改的文件,以及链接服务器的账号密码什么的 都在 macbook 里边
如果回家有紧急事件,没有开发环境还有各种连接 就很麻烦
如何能方便的同步这些数据,使得我可以不用背电脑来回上下班
或者有什么别的方案 比如把 macbook 放在家里,公司用 vnc 连接? 貌似这个可行性有待验证
目前家里目前有一个 win 台式机,公司还可以有一个 win 笔记本
articles.title: 如何才能不带笔记本来回上下班

articles.author: dragon11
articles.description:
dragon11: 
房贷银行的客户经理打电话说是可以换贷款。
因为我们的贷款利率比较高，6.2 左右。
说是换了之后就要低得多，好像是经营贷还是什么贷，说最多可以贷 30 年。
这种有没有什么坑？。
我知道肯定没有这么长的时间，而且万一银行抽贷就瓜了（好像听说过没额度啥的会抽贷）。
坐标成都，邮政银行。
articles.title: 银行建议房贷换贷款

articles.author: keenoappend
articles.description:
keenoappend: 使用软件 clash for Android
在手机使用移动流量 4G 开启 clash 时，
看油管都能流畅 4k 。
但是当手机连接家里 wifi 时（长城宽带），
看油管速度只有 500 多 kb/s 。
奇怪的是，之前没这个问题，而且设备没有做过任何配置修改和更换，就是突然网速被限制了。
怀疑是不是宽带供应商那边做了啥限制。
希望有 dalao 能帮忙解解疑惑😦。
articles.title: 一个关于魔法上网的问题

articles.description: xhuang327: RT ，最近润出去的想法越来越强烈。年过三十，想带着妻子孩子一起走，钱和语言方面先放一边，比较理想的是日本。可能 IT 类的专业工作上共性很大，财务类的话专业软件和相关的法律制度都不一样，感觉找工作是不是很困难。想问下彦祖们有没有什么好的渠道或者心得可以交流一下。

articles.title: 能推荐一个 600 左右的 98 键机械键盘吗?

articles.author: haozxuan001
articles.description:
haozxuan001: 
早上老婆上班比较早，会把冰箱里蒸熟的红薯拿出来放一会，避免吃起来太凉，然后由于我上班晚一个小时，所以今天早上我在吃第一口的时候就感觉，味道怪怪的，像是事物变质的味道，然后就和老婆说了这件事，老婆表示非常的吃惊，感觉就放在外面一个小时，不太可能变质，可我实际吃起来的确有股变质的味道，那种想说明或证明的强烈想法，却没有合适的工具或媒介清楚的描述和验证；
然后脑洞打开，当前我们可以将信息通过文字描述清楚，通过视频看的清楚，但还缺少一个“味道”的描述或记载方式，特别是 [当前时刻] 味道的记载方式，比如食堂为了保证食品安全会有留存箱保存当天的食物，用于后续验证，但像这块变质的红薯，需要表明他当前是变质的，而不是 8 个小时候后我老婆下班后看到的变质的样子；
在延伸一些，成年人常说记忆中小时候的味道，具体的味道可能会有不同的描述词语，但对于味道来讲，更像是一种有损的保存记载方式，那么有没有可能像哈利波特中邓布利多把记忆抽取并保存的方式，有一种化学卡片可以将当前的味道保存下来呢，期待科技的进步~
articles.title: 由早餐吃红薯想到的一个“用户需求”

articles.author: lanyulei
articles.description:
lanyulei: 
本人在 B 站 ，更新这一套 Client-Go 的视频教程，免费看的，没有后续套路，完整的视频，个人录制，放心食用。
如果觉得讲的不错的话，感谢关注和一键三连啊。
如果有讲错的地方，也欢迎指出呢。
articles.title: Client-Go 免费视频教程来来来了。

articles.author: tonychenc
articles.description:
tonychenc: 
我们是一个全员远程的团队，主要面向国外客户提供软件定制开发。
因新的业务扩张，现招聘 Python 后端工程师，主要做业务功能开发，非机器学习、非爬虫相关。
岗位要求：
沟通主动积极，有良好的职业素养、工作习惯和团队意识
有良好的代码书规范和代码提交规范
3 年以上 Python (3.x) 开发经验，熟悉至少一种 Web 框架技术：Django ，Flask 或其他
熟悉至少一种关系型数据库：SQLServer / MySQL / MariaDB / PostgresSQL ，有良好的设计思维
熟悉至少一种 MQ 技术
了解 Docker 或 Kubernetes ，有容器化概念
英语需要能阅读，听说写如果不错，也可以参与到跟国外客户沟通
薪资范围在 11-17K/月。
其它还在招聘的岗位（全职），岗位信息可以请点击下面链接查看：
前端工程师 （技术方面有所调整）
目前招聘只招 React
需要熟悉 Reactive Programing 思想，使用过 RxJS, React-RxJS
使用过 Jest 、React Testing Library 或其它前端单元测试工具
vx (base64)：dG9ueWNoZW5j
articles.title: [全职远程] 招聘后端 Python 工程师 和 前端 React 工程师

articles.author: boogoogle
articles.description:
boogoogle: 关键词：
远程办公
早 10 晚 6
5 年以上工作经验
中大厂工作经历
薪资：20-50k/month
联系邮箱： boogoogle@163.com （因为公司邮箱有个人名字，所以用自己邮箱了）

articles.title: 远程办公，不卷。求 React 前端， NodeJS， ReactNative 开发大佬 [20-50K]

articles.author: dabaoziwy
articles.description:
dabaoziwy: 
    午休过后，母亲打来了一通视频通话。视频中，父亲躺在楼梯上小憩，睡的很香。本想随意回复下就去继续敲代码，蓦然发现我的父亲怎么变得这么瘦了，头发也几乎花白了。
    一瞬间回忆涌动，想起了小时候，父亲每次出差回来都会给我带玩具，每次生日会带我去吃肯德基，每次喝醉酒后和我称兄道弟，每次考试考砸了都会抽出皮带追着我跑半条街。中考考上市重点，父亲在亲戚朋友面前的意气风发。高考失利后轻拍我的后背说着没事自己却坐在沙发上抽了一夜的烟。
    不知不觉已经毕业两年多了，仔细算了下，这两年下来回家的次数不超过一只手。通电话时他们会说，邻居家的小花猫又生了一窝，抑或是哪个亲戚家的小孩订婚结婚，哈哈，总是这样子醉翁之意不在酒。另我意外的是这些话往往会从我父亲的嘴中说出来，而母亲就在旁边催促他赶紧挂电话不要给孩子压力。我总是觉得我还年轻，不把他的话语放在心上，但是今天突然看到父亲的那副模样，我突然理解了。原来他们变老的速度会比我们长大的速度快这么多啊，还以为他们永远不会变老呢。
    看着屏幕上的代码发了许久的呆，继续敲起代码，嗯，赶紧把活做完，今晚回家！
articles.title: 突如其来的多愁善感，差点没忍住在工位上泪崩了

articles.author: joesonw
articles.description:
joesonw: 自己业余想做点东西，苦于没有好的 idea/方向。
请问大家如果有这样一个平台，员工可以根据需求申请不同的云的不同资源资源点权限，运维等审批人员可以一键审核后自动同步到各云。或收回，限定时间，审计等等
。不知道各位觉得这样的产品 h 各位的公司需要或者愿意尝试吗？ 或者缺了关键的功能？ 还是有些便利的功能点是一个很好的加分项？
谢谢大家的任何意见。
articles.title: 多云账号权限管理平台 [问下大家的意见]

articles.author: rookie333
articles.description:
rookie333: 例如二手交易那个教育优惠耳机不愿接受 v 友给价格区间，甚至觉得别人要么缺钱 or 以次充好（假货？）
其实大家大多数人都已经不是在校生或者教师吧，明明自己已经占便宜（薅羊毛）了，却还是不愿意去多花一点时间了解同一个站内的售价信息呢，会觉得自己吃大亏？
我记得我蹲了好久才等到了 618 买 499 的 gwp ，结果 7 月就在抖音看到了 459 的 gwp ，其实第一时间也觉得自己血亏了，但是还是得接受啊
记得很久很急之前看到一个文章，大概内容是：
我在买按个卖的椰子，但是我并没挑最大的那个，因为我觉得我只需要暂时的解渴罢了，如果一口气喝不完我还需要拿着它走很久，反而是个负担（卖椰子的大妈还觉得奇怪，这人怎么不挑最大的）
articles.title: 为什么大多数人都不能接受“吃亏”

articles.author: sbabybird
articles.description:
sbabybird: 
win10 电脑，自带杀毒，未装各种大师和助手；
长期不关机，只用来打游戏（地平线 4 ）和上网（ youtube ）；
结果前两天发现玩游戏时竟然卡顿，开始怀疑显卡问题，后发现是内存满了；
一时竟无法查出什么导致的内存泄露；
各位彦祖，是否遇到过同类情况，有无命令可让其续命一下？
articles.title: Win10 两个月没关机，结果内存占用越来越满，直至无法使用，不得不重启。此种情况有无清理办法？

articles.author: godall
articles.description:
godall: Windows10 的机器，INTEL 核显，可用内存 /总内存老是在 6.8/7.9=87%。
特定看了一下主要的大应用：
1. 同花顺炒股软件，至少 8 个进程，内存占用 1.5G
2. 微信 PC 版，差不多 5 个进程，内存占用 1.0G
3. ms edge 浏览器，开 1 个页面有 13 个进程（ 5 个插件），1.2G
4. ms defender ，300M
5. dwm.exe 不知道是啥，300M
6. explorer ，210M
7. outlook 150M
8. excel 开 3 个文件，数据量 70000 条，带 vbs ，基本上 1G 了，计算时经常提醒 32 位的内存不够。
9. everything ，150M
10.ms 全文索引，180M
11.ms 输入法，90M
还有无数占用 100M 一下的进程。
大家看看有什么值得优化的地方？
articles.title: 现在 8G 内存笔记本真的不够了，不做开发只办公也惨啊

articles.author: nii
articles.description:
nii: 
https://imgur.com/a/K29534g
用了两天了 感觉很不错 手感非常舒服
articles.title: 为什么那么多人觉得丑呢 搞的我都不自信了

articles.author: yitalin
articles.description:
yitalin: 
http://speedtest.im/
这个网站每天 ip 也有 1000+了，也在考虑怎么多做几个页面，包括测速排行榜其实后台一直都有收集测速结果的，就是不知道做什么样的界面来显示，欢迎大家提建议反映问题，因为测速节点 1 、2 是多任务下载各大平台的 app 测速，所以一直都有人反应 IDM 弹窗问题，目前只能这样解决了，以下是近期更新：
电脑用户访问会切换默认节点为 speedtest.net 节点，告别 IDM 弹窗
收藏节点（ COOKIE 保存）始终将会优先显示
不可用的测速节点自动移除
适配深色主题模式，用户深色主题自动切换
收藏功能+全球 /国内节点切换功能很好用，许多外省的节点速度一样可以跑满，点国内节点按钮就能切换更多节点，找到最适合你的测速点
articles.title: Speedtest.im 测速网站做了几项更新，告别 IDM 弹窗

articles.author: fiypig
articles.description:
fiypig: 
不用太大型的项目,能学习代码风格思想之类的,有用上 redis mongodb 之类的
articles.title: Java 有哪些开源项目值得啃的...求大佬推荐

articles.author: yhm2046
articles.description:
yhm2046: 
公司新买一台服务器 b ，服务器 a 原来的空间都清空释放，只用作 git 服务器，都是 dell 的。
公司最多同时 5 个同事使用，刚开始还挺快的，编译 android10 源码一个半小时。后面越来越慢，source 环境就比原来慢很多，从昨天开始 git statu ，git push 之类的命令执行很慢，今天中午一个多小时才显示 git status
了解到 b 都是机械硬盘，a 主硬盘是固态的，这个情况跟固态有关吗？
articles.title: 服务器运行 git 命令很慢是硬盘的原因吗？

articles.author: rome753
articles.description:
rome753: 

大部分博客主页太过枯燥。我试了一下个人博客 Hexo ，发现虽然功能很强大，可定制性也很高，然而定制起来也很麻烦，大部分只能改改颜色样式排版等。我想做的是一个独一无二个人博客页面，比如有树状图、物理碰撞或者 WebGL 3D 效果等。
目前用 box2d.js 实现了重力、物理碰撞效果，用 WebGL 实现了 3D 效果，并且鼠标可以拖动和点击跳转。
地址在这里，欢迎访问。
https://rome753.github.io/
articles.title: 做一个独一无二的重力版个人博客

articles.author: TongY
articles.description:
TongY: 
硅谷独角兽 Flexport 研发创始团队深圳上海诚招有工匠精神的技术大牛
Flexport 获得软银等多家公司和机构的投资，最近一轮融资后估值 80 亿美金。Flexport 是一家提供全方位海陆空服务的科技货运代理公司, 在 YC 中诞生, Flexport 已经成为全球领先货运代理服务创企, 帮助超过 15,000 家公司交付货物 , 业务覆盖全球 112 个国家 /地区, 2021 年盈利 33 亿美元，货品价值达 190 亿美元。
•我们是硅谷小公司文化, 求的是做事的扎实务实 , 解决实际问题, 和对技术的喜爱和工匠精神.
•我们国内的团队将针对国内用户开发产品, 高度复杂的业务和技术难题 , 任务艰巨, 富有挑战.
•我们工程师不分前端后端, 可以更加全面的接触技术. 我们会和美国硅谷技术团队一起合作, 可以一起学习.
•弹性工作时间, 做技术是需要一定创造力的, 我们完全不加班.
公司地址
目前我们正在组建上海创始研发团队, 欢迎现在加入上海团队能够获得更大影响力和更多的成长空间. 同时也欢迎加入我们的深圳团队.
深圳 南山区中国华润大厦 7 楼
上海 静安区越商大厦 5 楼
工作内容 /技术要求 （各个级别的 engineer 都有招聘）
•熟练掌握一门后台开发语言: Ruby(Rails), Java, Javascript, Go, C++, C# 等等.
•我们的技术栈主要是 Spring Boot, Rails, React.
•扎实的计算机科学基础知识, 熟悉操作系统, 数据库, 常见数据结构和算法,以及软件设计实践.
•对技术认真,务实解决问题,热爱技术.
•书面英文沟通能力,能够阅读英文技术文档.
福利
•有竞争力的 cash+非常有前景的 RSU
•补充商业医疗保险, 国际部 /私立医院直付以及配偶子女保险
•办公外设, 我们了解程序员对于生产力工具的要求
o顶配 MacBook Pro, 在 Apple Store 标准配置能选到的最高配版本(i9 + 32G + 512G)
o两台戴尔 4K 显示器
oJetbrains IDE 旗舰版
•职业发展支持
o线上培训, 包括 LinkedIn Learning 和 O'Reilly Learning
其他资料
•中文官网: https://cn.flexport.com/
•Crunchbase: https://www.crunchbase.com/organization/flexport
•YC: https://www.ycombinator.com/companies/flexport
•微信公众号搜索: Flexport
简历投递：招聘经理微信 Vikki_Yao
articles.title: 硅谷独角兽 Flexport 研发创始团队深圳上海诚招各级别工程师

articles.author: AndrewRen
articles.description:
AndrewRen: 
随着国内和海外业务的飞速发展，TapTap Android 端面临着更多技术挑战，比如多仓，比如组件化等；
所以，急需一名 Android 端架构师加入我们，一同来攻坚，一同来前进；
岗位 JD 具体如下：
工作职责：
1.负责公司移动端产品技术选型与研发、统筹落地工作；
2.与业务、产品配合，深度参与产品需求的讨论，主导关键技术方案选型和 App 架构设计；
3.实现质量可靠、性能卓越且高可复用的组件；
4.持续优化移动端产品和技术创新，提升产品的用户体验。

任职资格：
1.本科及以上学历，计算机、通信等相关专业，5 年以上工作经验；
2.具备扎实的 Java/Kotlin 编程能力，精通 Android Framework 等底层技术
3.掌握 Android/iOS 内存管理、多线程、常用数据结构、操作系统知识；
4.熟悉 APP 内性能优化，内存泄漏 /抖动、启动优化、卡顿优化、ANR\crash 治理；
5.有丰富的软件架构设计、基础组件 /SDK 研发经验，能快速搭建、重构大规模软件代码；
6.熟悉 Android 系统打包编译流程、插件化、热修复等主流技术原理；

加分项：
1.熟悉 Android 底层源代码
2.有开源项目贡献

公司福利好，一日三餐免费，无限量供应，各类零食饮料应有尽有；
升降桌，工学椅，写一天代码，腰部酸腿不疼，一口气爬五楼；
还有最好电脑和最快的网速，心动不如行动～～～
结尾挂一下友链，我们也在招 iOS 端负责人，有兴趣的小伙伴可以速速报名～
联系可以发送邮箱： renlong@xd.com
articles.title: [上海][TapTap] Android 端架构师

articles.author: dtgxx
articles.description:
dtgxx: 比如我电脑安装了爱奇艺，我想下载，之前点击下载就会直接打开我本机的爱奇艺，但是我就是想要个安装包，现在好像不会这样了吧。   又比如我想下载 chrome ，我用 mac ，但是我想下载 windows 安装包，进入到 chrome 界面，下载的就是 mac 的安装包，如何不让网站去猜测这类事情。
有没有 chrome 的各版本官方最新版下载链接。。。
articles.title: 如何不让浏览器评估我下载软件的信息

articles.author: eachann
articles.description:
eachann: 
装上 Alttab 之后，就使用 cmd + tab 替代系统的切换方式了
自从系统升级到了 bate 5 ，alttab 无法打开了，请问怎么解决这个问题呢。卸载会恢复吗
articles.title: 关于 Mac cmd + tab 切换窗口失效

articles.author: Grace Ebert
articles.description:
Constellations, butterflies, and bold checkered prints overlay the animalistic forms by Anne Lemanski. Beginning with a copper armature, the North Carolina-based artist stretches vintage paper or patterns of scanned objects across a minimal metal form and stitches the edges together into a geometric patchwork.
Ranging from abstract shapes to illustrations and photos, the printed motifs evoke each character’s temperament, presence, and overall essence. “Stella Terra,” for example, is sheathed in white paper, and images of animals and objects speckle the ephemeral material similar to the spotted coat of the live Appaloosa counterpart. More
articles.title: In a Patterned Menagerie, Artist Anne Lemanski Stitches Printed Papers into Animal Forms

articles.author: Grace Ebert
articles.description: A grotesquely beautiful monster with monarch wings, long feathered lashes, and a curiously large mouth has taken over a corner building in Montréal. The cheeky puppet mural is by French-Canadian artist Danaé Brissonnet in collaboration with Poncili Creacion and stands at the intersection of Boulevard Saint Laurent and Rue Marie Anne. Centered around the theme of digestion, the massive public work is a playful, metaphorical interpretation of the bodily process. “These days I’m intrigued with exploring the ways in which I nourish myself… the who and what I let inside,” Brissonnet writes on Instagram. More
articles.title: A Playfully Grotesque Monster Peeks Out of Danaé Brissonnet’s Ravenous Mural in Montréal

articles.author: Colossal
articles.description: We’re thrilled to announce our monthly series of workshops that explore incredible creativity from leading visual artists. We even have a shiny, new way to stay in the loop about upcoming events with our Colossal Workshops newsletter. Following the remarkable response to our forthcoming session with Hollie Chastain—which is now sold out—we look forward to inviting you to a new class next month! Colossal Members always receive a discount on registration and have access to a growing library of recordings. More
articles.title: Make, Learn, and Share Creative Skills in Colossal’s Monthly Virtual Workshops

articles.author: Grace Ebert
articles.description: The annual Nature TTL Photographer of the Year contest garnered more than 8,000 submissions this round, with some of the most impressive images focusing on fauna in the wild and stunning light-based phenomena that illuminate nighttime skies. Taken around the globe, the winning photos demonstrate both acts of stealth and moments of serendipity. Images range from Matt Engelmann capturing an unaware dog fox as it creeps over a Swiss mountain to Mauro Tronto framing a rainbow shooting upwards from the misty Godafass waterfalls in Iceland, the glowing northern lights overhead. More
articles.title: Phenomenal Skies and Animals in Action Top This Year’s Nature TTL Photography Contest

articles.author: Grace Ebert
articles.description: Healthy fibers meet delicious decadence in Normalynn Ablao’s crocheted provisions. The California-based crafter and pattern maker is cooking up spring rolls, pies, and party-sized platters of chicken wings, crudites, and dip, all made with yarn. Like her pastas, Ablao continues to serve textured designs that mimic their edible counterparts, although she tends to have a taste for cakes, pies, and other baked goods that you can find on Instagram. More
articles.title: Kitchen Stitching: Pies, Pastries, and Chicken Wings Are Crocheted into Delectable Fiber-Based Cuisine

articles.author: Grace Ebert
articles.description:
What do an injured Kelley O’Hara and “The Incredulity of Saint Thomas” by Italian Baroque artist Mattia Preti have in common? The exasperated soccer star and 1675 religious masterpiece find unexpected synchronicity thanks to LJ Rader, the creator behind the wildly popular meme account ArtButMakeItSports.
Since 2015, Rader has been cleverly pairing photos from professional sports with art historical works. What began as a personal project that involved visits to museums and some of the week’s most intensely emotional images from soccer matches or basketball games has evolved into Twitter and Instagram accounts with considerable followings.  More
articles.title: Sports and Art History Team Up in a Playful Twitter Account That Matches Life and Art

articles.author: Kate Mothes
articles.description: In the National Museum of Scotland in Edinburgh, an enormous single-cell organism floats among the Victorian iron colonnades of the cavernous Grand Gallery. Bristol-based multidisciplinary artist Luke Jerram often explores the nature of scale and perception in his pieces (previously), and the latest installation of his inflatable sculpture “E.coli,” which has been displayed in locations around the U.K., spans 90 feet, representing the bacterium at 5 million times its actual size. More
articles.title: An Enormous ‘E.coli’ Floats Through the National Museum of Scotland at 5 Million Times Its Actual Size

articles.author: Grace Ebert
articles.description: Polish artist NeSpoon (previously) continues to add to her expansive collection of murals that merge local craft traditions and street art. Having traveled around Europe in recent months, she’s completed pieces in France, Spain, and Italy, to name a few, and each oversized motif recreates a lace pattern sourced from a museum or resident at a massive scale. The resulting works, which are spray-painted in white, are intricate studies of the region’s florals, ornamental styles, and tatting methods and how they differ throughout cultures and eras. More
articles.title: Delicate Lace Patterns Overlay Facades in Ornate Large-Scale Murals by NeSpoon

articles.author: Grace Ebert
articles.description: Tucked inside clear glass vessels are Ayumi Shibata’s regal architectural vistas and layered cities enveloped by trees and vines. The Japanese artist is known for her elaborately constructed paper sculptures that fill small spaces like books and jars or occupy entire rooms, all of which are alluring and immersive as they draw viewers in to the enchanting, dream-like environments. Because the artist uses solely white paper, each sculpture highlights the intricacies of her cuts, and the details are enhanced even further when illuminated. More
articles.title: Glass Pitchers and Vessels Encase Architectural Paper Sculptures by Ayumi Shibata

articles.author: Grace Ebert
articles.description:
Although research suggests the ancient Venus figurines were created as totems of survival amid a changing climate, the enigmatic forms continue to puzzle historians, their exact cultural context and relevance unknown. The mysterious statues, with exaggerated physical features like large, distended bellies and generally plump appendages, recently inspired a playful project by Naama Steinbock and Idan Friedman, the designers behind Reddish Studio based in Tel Aviv-Jaffa.
Titled “Venus of Jaffa,” the series interprets the prehistoric sculptures as lighthearted, impermanent forms. More
articles.title: Balloons Inflate Around Copper Forms in a Playful Reinterpretation of the Enigmatic Venus Figures

articles.author: Jody Serrano
articles.description:
Gird your inboxes. A vote by the Federal Election Commission on Thursday indicates that more political spam emails may be coming for Gmail users. 
Read more...
articles.title: Feds Approve Google's Plan to Let Political Campaigns Send More Spam

articles.author: Artem Golub and Kevin Hurler
articles.description: Read more...
articles.title: Uh Oh, Amazon Bought Your Favorite Robot Company

articles.author: Sabina Graves
articles.description:
Loungefly’s Liz DeSilva, VP of Creative, and Derrick Baca, VP of Business Development and Merchandising, are  the minds behind the iconic mini-backpack line you see people wearing virtually everywhere, from conventions to theme parks to grocery stores. The versatility and imagery used on their products—including …
Read more...
articles.title: Loungefly's Creative Minds on Making Fandom Fashion for Everyone

articles.author: James Whitbrook
articles.description:
From The Girl Who Leapt Through Time to Belle, from Summer Wars to Wolf Children, Studio Chizu co-founder Mamoru Hosoda has crafted some stunning animated movies in his long career. Now, a new artbook takes a look at the process behind bringing those movies to life.

Read more...
articles.title: Go Behind the Scenes of One of Anime's Most Talented Moviemakers in This Stunning New Artbook

articles.author: Passant Rabie
articles.description:
A U.S. military general expressed frustration over a recently launched Russian satellite that appears to be stalking a U.S. military satellite in space. 
Read more...
articles.title: U.S. Officials Are Not Happy About Russia's Supposed 'Stalker' Satellite

articles.author: Germain Lussier
articles.description:
When modern comic book movie fans think of breaking the fourth wall, they probably think of Deadpool. And for good reason. He’s very popular. But well before the Merc with the Mouth pointed that mouth at the fans, another Marvel Comics character was doing it and she’s finally joining the MCU. Her name is She-Hulk and…
Read more...
articles.title: She-Hulk's Fourth-Wall Breaking Went Through Many Iterations

articles.author: Lucas Ropek
articles.description:
In 2016, cybersecurity pro Patrick Wardle heard a story that deeply disturbed him: cybercriminals were using malware to surreptitiously spy on people through their MacOS webcams and microphones. In one particularly unsettling case, a hacker had used a malware called “Fruitfly” to hijack the webcams of laptops with the…
Read more...
articles.title: What to Do if a Big Tech Company Steals Your Code

articles.author: Kyle Barr
articles.description:
Do you remember back in March when international analysts were equal parts terrified by the prospect of North Korean intercontinental ballistic missiles and bemused by Supreme Leader Kim Jong-un’s self parody-level video promoting their military might? Well, evidence produced by experts on missile proliferation and…
Read more...
articles.title: Remember When North Korea Launched Its Massive ICBM? Well, They Probably Faked It

articles.author: Linda Codega
articles.description:
If you haven’t watched Nope yet, do not watch this trailer. Jordan Peele’s newest horror film is still out in theaters, and if you’ve got the chance to see this stunner on the big screen, take it. This trailer is fantastic—but it also spoils the movie’s big reveal.
Read more...
articles.title: This Nope Trailer Is Great, But You Really Shouldn't Watch It

articles.author: Mack DeGeurin
articles.description:
If you’ve taken a good look at the night sky in recent years you may have noticed a few more twinkling lights. That’s largely due to a surge in low Earth orbit satellites, an increasing number of which are being deployed to offer satellite internet service. SpaceX, OneWeb, and Amazon, the latter through its…
Read more...
articles.title: DARPA Wants to Build an 'Internet' of Connected Satellites in Low Earth Orbit

articles.author: Isaac Schultz
articles.description:
This may be your best chance of meeting a great white shark that doesn’t involve dressing up like a seal and covering yourself in blood. The shark-tracking organization OCEARCH is launching a sweepstakes for a lucky winner to join the OCEARCH team on an upcoming research expedition, a trip that will inevitably feature…
Read more...
articles.title: Marine Biologists Are Offering a Rare Chance to Meet a Great White Shark

articles.author: Angely Mercado
articles.description:
A record-breaking hot, dry summer in Europe has lowered the Rhine River’s water levels so much that it has threatened shipping in the region. 

Read more...
articles.title: Photos Reveal Just How Dire Things Are for Germany's Rhine River

articles.author: Rob Bricken
articles.description:
Just like the zombies of the venerable Walking Dead franchise have begun to evolve, so, it seems, has the franchise itself. Before the last eight episodes of the flagship TV show premiere in October, AMC will debut the six-episode anthology series Tales of the Walking Dead this Sunday, which not only looks at new…
Read more...
articles.title: Tales of the Walking Dead Season 2 May Include a Musical Episode

articles.author: Germain Lussier
articles.description:
Avatar, written and directed by James Cameron, was released in 2009 and became the highest grossing film ever—which it still is to this day.

Read more...
articles.title: Everything We Know About James Cameron's Avatar Sequels

articles.author: Kyle Barr and Dell Cameron
articles.description:
Despite years of tech companies tracking users, gathering data on their online activities and selling it for profit, few government entities have done anything tangible to halt the hoarding of people’s online information. But it looks like the Federal Trade Commission is putting on its bright orange vest, thinking it…
Read more...
articles.title: FTC Is Exploring Ways to Crack Down on Big Tech's Obsession With User Data

articles.author: Lauren Leffer
articles.description:
It’s a bird, it’s a plane—no wait, it’s a migrating moth... being followed by a plane?

Read more...
articles.title: Researchers Stalked Death’s-Head Hawkmoths in a Plane to Learn Their Navigation Secrets

articles.author: Passant Rabie
articles.description:
Orbital debris from a Russian anti-satellite weapons test is menacing the Starlink satellite constellation, with  researchers  reporting more than 6,000 close calls with the SpaceX satellites. 

Read more...
articles.title: Debris 'Squalls' From Russian Anti-Satellite Test Continually Threaten SpaceX's Starlink

articles.author: Linda Codega
articles.description:
What We Do in the Shadows is one of my favorite shows currently airing. It focuses on the foibles of a house full of vampires who regularly have a rotating cast of friends and familiars pop in. The resident familiar, Guillermo de la Cruz (Harvey Guillén), is another constant, and he is arguably the heart of the show.

Read more...
articles.title: What We Do in the Shadows’ Best Man Is Guillermo de la Cruz

articles.author: Dell Cameron
articles.description:
Twitter, which has a spotty history of applying policies governing misinformation, hate speech, and inciting rhetoric from government officials, elected representatives, and unverified propagandists, said Thursday that it is working to ensure “healthy civic conversation” ahead of the U.S. midterms.

Read more...
articles.title: Here's What Twitter Says It's Doing to Protect the 2022 Midterms

articles.author: Florence Ion
articles.description:
Razer has announced the DeathAdder V3 Pro gaming mouse, the third-generation follow up to its popular DeathAdder lineup. The mouse promises better ergonomics and a lighter build for extended gaming sessions. But its biggest trick is that it pairs up with the sold-separately HyperPolling Wireless Dongle, which promises…
Read more...
articles.title: Razer's New DeathAdder V3 Pro Promises Super Fast Polling Without Wires

articles.author: James Whitbrook
articles.description:
Kamen Rider has existed in many forms in its long history, from TV and film to, of course, creator Shotaro Ishinomori’s own classic manga. But how do you bring a series that has such a peculiar history in the west to contemporary Western comics? 
Read more...
articles.title: Kamen Rider Zero-One's Creative Team on Bringing the Tokusatsu Icon to Western Comics

articles.author: Cheryl Eddy
articles.description:
You’ve heard of classic Archie Comics character Li’l Jinx, a mischievous tyke who earned her unusual name by being born on Halloween? Replace “tyke” with “teen” (and lose the “Li’l”) and you’ve got the main character of Chilling Adventures Presents... Jinx’s Grim Fairy Tales, a new Archie Horror one-shot that io9 is…
Read more...
articles.title: Halloween Arrives Early in this Archie Horror Comic Sneak Peek

articles.author: Mack DeGeurin
articles.description:
Ethereum is closer than it’s ever been to ditching its highly energy intensive proof-of-work model for a proof-of-stake (POS) alternative.
Read more...
articles.title: Ethereum's Final Proof-of-Stake Test Deemed a 'Success'

articles.author: Rob Bricken
articles.description:
If you watched the tragicomic, canon-heavy, highly revealing finale of Rick and Morty season five, which gave not only a peek at Rick’s real origin and the origin of the Citadel of Ricks—to say nothing of evil Morty’s plan—then you might be expecting season six to pick up right where the last episode left off. But…
Read more...
articles.title: Rick and Morty Get Paranoid in Their New Season 6 Trailer

articles.author: Gizmodo Staff
articles.description:
One of the most critical problems humans currently have is how to generate power efficiently. We have many ways of generating electric power, but all have their drawbacks—some are devastating for the environment, some are difficult to scale, and some have been sidelined for years due to fears about safety. As we move…
Read more...
articles.title: Degrees of the Future 2022: Energy Engineering

articles.author: Gizmodo Staff
articles.description:
Biomedical engineering will help us go beyond the antibiotics, antivirals, and steroids that dominated last century’s medical arsenal. From drug-carrying nanorobots to genetic and tissue engineering, biomedical engineers build the technologies required for state-of-the-art medicine. According to the American Society…
Read more...
articles.title: Degrees of the Future 2022: Biomedical Engineering

articles.author: Gizmodo Staff
articles.description:
Knowledge of astronomy and astrophysics is crucial to understanding some of the most fundamental questions of our universe. We cannot know the origins of anything—from galaxies to black holes to life itself—without studying the cosmos in detail. New telescope missions are bringing us closer to answers, but it takes…
Read more...
articles.title: Degrees of the Future 2022: Astronomy & Astrophysics

articles.author: Gizmodo Staff
articles.description:
Spaceflight, once the sole domain of government-backed agencies like NASA and Roscosmos, is now a thriving commercial venture, and innovations in rocketry and orbital technology are increasingly coming from private companies. At the same time, space agencies are still creating incredible new tech (like fully electric…
Read more...
articles.title: Degrees of the Future 2022: Aerospace & Astronautical Engineering

articles.author: Gizmodo Staff
articles.description:
Automated systems have long dominated manufacturing, but now they’re moving into customer service, medical care, warfare, and so many other environments—they’re even controlling the rovers currently driving around Mars. “Robotics is extremely important, since it has the potential to help humans to solve complex,…
Read more...
articles.title: Degrees of the Future 2022: Autonomy & Robotics

articles.author: Gizmodo Staff
articles.description:
User experience design affects everyone, from voters trying to understand their ballots to a grandparent trying to video call with their grandchild. It’s crucial that these interfaces meet their moment, by making technologies like health care portals and smartphones as intuitive as possible. “User experience runs the…
Read more...
articles.title: Degrees of the Future 2022: UX Design

articles.author: Gizmodo Staff
articles.description:
Games are a reflection of our world and help shape the way we see it. For children, games can be a way of learning fundamental interpersonal and problem-solving skills—and so the way games are designed has a very real impact on society. “There’s been a shift away from tangible, mechanical approaches to design and more…
Read more...
articles.title: Degrees of the Future 2022: Game Design

articles.author: Gizmodo Staff
articles.description:
As our ability to gather huge amounts of information grows, so does our need to analyze it. “It’s such a fundamental driver of progress,” said Yves-Alexandre de Montjoye, a data scientist at Imperial College London and Special Adviser on AI and data protection to the European Commission’s Justice Commissioner, “when…
Read more...
articles.title: Degrees of the Future 2022: Data Science

articles.author: Gizmodo Staff
articles.description:
In 2020, a patient in Germany died after hackers disrupted IT systems at a hospital, forcing a delay in her treatment. Ransom-seeking cyberattacks on health care systems have become a growing threat, showing the life-or-death stakes of modern cybersecurity. It’s crucial that computers are adequately guarded against…
Read more...
articles.title: Degrees of the Future 2022: Cybersecurity

articles.author: Gizmodo Staff
articles.description:
Computer graphics determine how we experience and interact with technology; innovations in this field can literally change how we see the world. Work here will be relevant to a wide range of fields, from entertainment to medical imaging and training. “Computer graphics are needed in so many important aspects of our…
Read more...
articles.title: Degrees of the Future 2022: Computer Graphics

articles.author: Gizmodo Staff
articles.description:
A degree in artificial intelligence will soon be relevant to just about any field. As the problems humans try to solve become bigger, some of the best solutions may be achieved with AI. AI involves subdisciplines like machine learning and deep learning, both of which are means by which computers can be trained to…
Read more...
articles.title: Degrees of the Future 2022: Artificial Intelligence

articles.author: Gizmodo Staff
articles.description:
Neuroscientists study the brain and its various complex capabilities, from memory and learning to human behavior and consciousness. Neuroscientists generally need PhDs to do their work, which often is in a hospital or university setting. But neuroscience is an interdisciplinary field that may require knowledge of…
Read more...
articles.title: Degrees of the Future 2022: Neuroscience

articles.author: Gizmodo Staff
articles.description:
Molecular and cellular biology probe the itsy-bitsy processes that make us human, from DNA replication to cell division. “It started out to be a pure scientific investigation of some absolutely classic questions in science,” said David Baltimore, biologist at Caltech and the Broad Institute and 1975 Nobel laureate.…
Read more...
articles.title: Degrees of the Future 2022: Molecular & Cellular Biology

articles.author: Gizmodo Staff
articles.description:
Immunology and virology respectively study the strengths and weaknesses of our body’s immune system, and some of the most dangerous threats to them: viruses. As new viral outbreaks emerge and familiar viruses mutate into new threats, it’s crucial to know how our bodies can adapt.
Read more...
articles.title: Degrees of the Future 2022: Immunology & Virology

articles.author: Gizmodo Staff
articles.description:
The study of the causes of diseases and their spread will continue to be crucial, particularly as climate change presents us with new health challenges and worsens the threat of pandemics. “Epidemiology provides analytic tools to better understand and respond to the urgent problems we are facing now, which will only…
Read more...
articles.title: Degrees of the Future 2022: Epidemiology

articles.author: Gizmodo Staff
articles.description:
Genetics is the study of inheritance—from someone’s brown eyes to their inability to eat dairy. Taken together with genomics—the study of the entire genome of an organism—researchers get better at understanding overall human health, and how to fight  diseases. 
Read more...
articles.title: Degrees of the Future 2022: Genetics

articles.author: Gizmodo Staff
articles.description:
In the 1950s, a visionary college student might have pursued a degree in computer science, and helped create our modern digital world. In the 1990s, that same student might have studied biotechnology, and developed genetic engineering techniques that are solving today’s health crises. But what and where should a…
Read more...
articles.title: Gizmodo's Degrees of the Future 2022

articles.author: Isaac Schultz
articles.description:
Gizmodo has partnered with the independent market research provider Statista to identify the top universities within 25 fields of study that we believe will define the 21st century. But which academic disciplines did we look at, and why?
Read more...
articles.title: These Are the Degrees of the Future

articles.author: Gizmodo Staff
articles.description:
Cities need to be designed to be more energy efficient, resilient, and affordable. Urban planners today are dealing with challenges that didn’t exist 30 years ago, including more frequent and more extreme weather emergencies. They’re also dealing with the impacts of decisions made long ago, like the prioritization of…
Read more...
articles.title: Degrees of the Future 2022: Urban Planning

articles.author: Gizmodo Staff
articles.description:
Runaway growth and rampant waste cannot continue the way they did in the 20th century—our natural resources are limited, and environmental destruction is an existential threat to both wildlife and human society. From fisheries management, to corporate sustainability, to designing the apartments of the future,…
Read more...
articles.title: Degrees of the Future 2022: Sustainability

articles.author: Gizmodo Staff
articles.description:
Environmental and climate scientists help monitor Earth’s environment and investigate humans’ relationship with it. Understanding climate change and its effects is crucial for mitigating its immediate impacts. Earth’s environments are changing as the planet warms due to human industry. Building better climate models…
Read more...
articles.title: Degrees of the Future 2022: Environmental Science & Climate Change

articles.author: Gizmodo Staff
articles.description:
As long as there are countries, international security will be an imperative field of the future—even if the venues of conflict change. Jobs in international relations can range from diplomatic posts and peacekeeping roles to roles in homeland security and law. In the future, international relations and international…
Read more...
articles.title: Degrees of the Future 2022: International Relations & International Security Studies

articles.author: Gizmodo Staff
articles.description:
Gender and diversity studies have grown and expanded in scope since they first began at institutions of higher learning about 50 years ago. Diversity studies examines concepts like social class, race, ethnicity, gender, sociality, and age, among  others; gender studies focuses on the social structures that have…
Read more...
articles.title: Degrees of the Future 2022: Diversity & Gender Studies

articles.author: Gizmodo Staff
articles.description:
Microbiologists scrutinize some of the smallest lifeforms, from helpful gut microbes to dangerous pathogens. The study of microorganisms their impacts on human health will help us manage threats and even harness their potential benefits. The bacteria that call us home shape seemingly every aspect of our…
Read more...
articles.title: Degrees of the Future 2022: Medical Microbiology & Bacteriology

articles.author: Gizmodo Staff
articles.description:
Medicine has come so far in 100 years—and yet many diseases have eluded our best efforts at treatments and cures. You can think of health research and innovation as the catch-all R&D department for healthcare. It’s essential work: Research in cell lines, animals, and computer models steadily progresses into human…
Read more...
articles.title: Degrees of the Future 2022: Health Research & Innovation

articles.author: Gizmodo Staff
articles.description:
Health informatics broadly describes the streamlining of patient data processes and the administration of health care; it is an interdisciplinary field that is dedicated to fixing the health data ecosystem, thereby improving care for all patients. Data-driven approaches will overhaul older forms of medical record…
Read more...
articles.title: Degrees of the Future 2022: Health Informatics

articles.author: Gizmodo Staff
articles.description:
Environmental engineers help balance human needs and health with the preservation of nature, working to mitigate water and air pollution, manage stormwater runoff, and reduce erosion, among other issues. They will design future infrastructure and systems that are more efficient and less polluting. Their work will…
Read more...
articles.title: Degrees of the Future 2022: Environmental Engineering
